ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Severe to profound loss with no measurable speech recognition, consistent with history of cochlear vasculitis.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss (Left ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Slight to mild low-frequency loss sloping to severe; air-bone gaps present; hypercompliant tympanogram suggests middle ear pathology.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Wegener's Granulomatosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of systemic condition with cochlear and middle ear involvement explaining the complex asymmetric profile.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss.
To assess speech detection and recognition abilities, particularly given the asymmetry.
To evaluate middle ear status given the history of perforation and vasculitis.
Standard battery test, though not measured in this specific encounter.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a complex asymmetric hearing loss. The right ear exhibits severe sensorineural hearing loss sloping to profound, with no usable speech discrimination. The left ear shows a slight-to-mild mixed hearing loss sloping to severe sensorineural loss in the high frequencies, with excellent speech recognition. Immittance testing reveals a flat tympanogram (normal volume) on the right and hypercompliance on the left.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe SNHL (250-1500 Hz) sloping to profound (2000-8000 Hz); no response >4000 Hz. Left ear: Slight to mild mixed loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to severe (6000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SAT 88 dB HL; SRT and WRS CNT. Left ear: SRT 30 dB HL; WRS 96% at 75 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Flat (Type B) with normal ear canal volume. Left ear: Hypercompliant (Type Ad).

proposed_items: Hearing aid evaluation to discuss amplification options
Consideration of CROS system or hearing aid for the left ear
counseling_actions: Review test results, noting stability in the right ear and slight high-frequency deterioration in the left ear
Explain that fatigue is likely due to reliance on the left ear and constant head-turning
Advise on the importance of preserving remaining hearing in the left ear

escalation.rationale_short: Patient to follow up as scheduled for monitoring of Wegener's granulomatosis and ear health.

expected_outcome: Patient will follow up with an otologist as scheduled.
Patient advised to return annually for testing to monitor stability of hearing sensitivity.
Patient advised to return for a hearing aid evaluation to discuss options for amplification and HAT.
